testsuite.name: When the result is indented in the report XML file, the report HTML must serialize it with indentation.

testcase.name: So... (xspec/xspec#359) When x:result in the report XML file is a sequence of simple nested elements serialized with indentation, all elements in [Result] with diff must be serialized with indentation.

So... (xspec/xspec#359) When x:result in the report XML file is a sequence of simple nested elements serialized with indentation, all elements in [Result] without diff must be serialized with indentation.

So... (xspec/xspec#359) When x:expect in the report XML file is a sequence of simple nested elements serialized with indentation, all elements in [Expected Result] with diff must be serialized with indentation.

But the diff must not be affected by indentation. So... When a node is indented, the diff of the indented node itself must not be affected. (xspec/xspec#367) So... When <bar> is indented but <?bar?> is not indented in x:result of the report XML file, both <bar> and <?bar?> must be green.

But the diff must not be affected by indentation. So... When a node is indented, the diff of the indented node itself must not be affected. (xspec/xspec#367) So... When <bar> is indented but <?bar?> is not indented in x:expect of the report XML file, both <bar> and <?bar?> must be green.

But the diff must not be affected by indentation. So... When a child node of an element is indented, the diff of the element must not be affected. So, when the same <bar> in <foo> is indented in x:result and x:expect of the report XML file with different indentation length, <foo> must be green.
